result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L J Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon L J Hayes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon L J Hayes was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:51 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2016CM130 as a repeater and on count 1 on 2016CM140 as a repeater, and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2016CM130 and on count 1 on 2016CM140.  Court orders count 2 on 2016CM130 be dismissed and read-in and counts 2,3, & 4 are to be dismissed and read-in and count 5 is to be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016M130

-10 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2016CM140

-30 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-$700 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 29 months
-IID - 29 months.
-AODA & any follow-up (GL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant 1 day of sentence credit on 2016CM140.

Court adjourned at 11:03 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

10:23 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - has received a copy of the amended criminal complaint on 2016CM140, waives reading and enter a plea of NOT GUILTY.   Court goes over maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  Statement by Atty Roeth - request a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on December 6, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:26 a.m.
Status hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:11 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - Need an offer in the cases, and the blood test is still outstanding in 2016CM140.  Statement by DA Christenson.  Court sets for Status Hearing on 10/31/2016 at 10:00 a.m.  Court informs the defendant of his monies due.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
Notice of Hearing for Plea & Sentencing scheduled on 09/27/2016 at 2:00 p.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Insufficient Address.  Unable to Forward.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's
Defendant's

2:30 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled, waiting on Discovery on one of the cases.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 27, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:31 p.m.
By Atty Joey Roeth
Status hearing on August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:41 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant qualifies for PD representation.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 2, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:41 a.m.
Bond Payments / Check #8135
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.

9:00 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court notes bond has been set at $100 cash bond & condition.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 9:03 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2:33 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DA regarding charges.  Statement by DA - gives overview of the charges.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $100 cash bond and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to appear for Initial Appearance on June 14, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:38 p.m.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
